results.title: The Boy who turned off
results.creator_credit: Larry Kurnarsky, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An intimate portrait of a family’s struggle to cope with an autistic son. The film examines the effects of an endless cycle of successes and failures, the frustration’s of seeking treatment for a problem that still eludes definition, and the painful uncertainty of what the future will bring. A powerful, thought-provoking film for anyone who seeks to understand autism or the disabled person’s relations with family. Award: New York
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry Kurnarsky, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Try your fortune
results.creator_credit: Ziyin Wang, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Looks at immigration and cross cultural marriages. This program focuses on Chinese immigrants and marriages between Chinese citizens and Australians. Two Australian/Chinese couples are interviewed on aspects such as why they decided to get married, how their families felt about the marriage and how each Chinese person coped with language and monetary barriers when they first arrived in Australia. The program also looks at overseas students and why they are attracted to making Australia their permanent home. Discusses the steps Chinese spouses must take to convince the immigration department that the marriage is a ‘real’ one, and not one of convenience. Some interviews are conducted in Chinese. No subtitles are provided.

results.title: The Boxer [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Arthur Lappin, Hell's Kitchen and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Danny Flynn (Daniel Day Lewis) has just been released from prison after serving a 14 year sentence for something he didn’t do. Returning to his old neighbourhood, he is re-united with Maggie (Emily Watson), his child hood sweetheart, whose husband is also serving time in jail for his involvement with the IRA. Maggie is desperately unhappy raising her son alone and Danny’s presence brings some light to her depressing life. Danny and Maggie become close once again, much to the anger of their fellow neighbours and friends. Wanting to do something positive with his life, Danny draws on his past experience as a successful boxer and transforms the local community centre into a gym where he can teach the local children boxing. After a bomb goes off at the centre, Danny and Maggie are forced to make a decision about their future. Directed by Jim Sheridan (“In the name of the father”), “The Boxer” shows us the personal impact of Ireland’s political troubles. Also available on VHS [318846].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Sheridan, Arthur Lappin, Hell’s Kitchen and Universal Pictures

results.title: In our own image
results.creator_credit: Michael Karris, Barbara Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Michael Karris accompanies photographer Effy Alexakis and writer Leonard Janiszewski on a trip around New South Wales and Tasmania documenting the experiences of a Greek Australian for a forthcoming book.

results.title: We grow here
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Interviews with Sicilian migrants who ended up making the lush lands of Northern Queensland their home. The men and women describe the hardship of their lives in Sicily, talk about their initial impressions on arrival in Australia and explore their sometimes ambivalent attachments to their two “homelands”.

results.title: A Local stranger: Claude Beach in Julia Creek
results.creator_credit: Mark Shields-Brown, Barbara Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Claude Beach is a travelling portrait photographer touring the outback towns of Australia. A German immigrant, he has been on the move for the last twenty five or thirty years, travelling fifteen times all around Australia. This fragment of his solitary life shows him setting up shop in Julia Creek and drumming up business amongst the townsfolk there.
results.title_for_label: A Local stranger: Claude Beach in Julia Creek
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Shields-Brown, Barbara Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Something shining
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Something shining tells the story of a young pilot, Frederick Valentich, who disappeared with his small plane over Bass Strait as he returned from a flight to King Island. His enigmatic message of sighting “something shining” just before he disappeared has led many, including his parents, to believe he was captured by a UFO.

results.title: The Bonfire of the vanities
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description:
Brian De Palma’s adaptation of Tom Wolfe’s tome to political corruption and greed in New York City was an unmitigated disaster for the filmmaker and all involved. Playing against type, Tom Hanks was cast as Sherman McCoy, a slick Wall Street trader, who immersed in the high-pressure world of stocks and bonds, enjoys reaping the financial rewards of his job. But Sherman’s Achilles heel is his extramarital affair with Maria Ruskin, a buxom Southern belle, who amuses Sherman with her uneducated speech, but reveals a ruthless streak when she runs over a black teenager in Harlem and Sherman is sent to trial. It is drunken reporter Peter Fallow who uncovers the scandal, despite misgivings about the motivations of the players who help him. Unfortunately, encapsulating the many strains of Wolfe’s novel proved too complex for the script, which leaves many characters as ciphers and fails to flesh out the motivations of the central players. Nevertheless, within the context of the extravagant, tasteless excesses of the 1980s, the film serves as an intriguing tableau of corruptibility, vice, greed and human foibles.
Cast includes: Tom Hanks, Bruce Willis, Melanie Griffith, Kim Cattrall, Morgan Freeman, F. Murray Abraham

results.title: Silverbeat = Silverbeet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
The 50’s saw a massive intake of young immigrants from Europe, but as these immigrants approach old age the community is encountering problems in how best to cope with their needs, which may be very different from those of the anglo-saxon community to which most retirement and nursing homes are geared. Most of these people come from cultures in which it is not accepted practice to put the aged into institutions. This program looks at two different approaches to the problem - firstly by setting up retirement villages specifically aimed at particular immigrant groups, and secondly by initiating a variety of ethnic foods into the regime of a mixed retirement home.

results.title: The Blues brothers. Blues brothers 2000 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Landis, Dan Aykroyd, Leslie Belzberg, Robert K Weiss and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: BLUES BROTHERS: At last, the Blues Brothers are back! John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd star in one of the most popular musical comedies of all time. Jake and Elwood Blues, two hoodlum brothers searching for redemption, set out to locate and re-enlist the members of their defunct rhythm and blues band in order to fulfil a “mission from God”. In their quest they are joined by an impressive array of guest stars including James Brown, Aretha Franklin, Carrie Fisher, John Candy, Ray Charles, Twiggy, Cab Calloway and Steven Spielberg. This madcap film has everything from exciting soul and blues music to one of the most amazing car chase scenes ever filmed, a film not to be missed. BLUES BROTHERS 2000: After serving 18 years for the chaos he was responsible for in the original film, Jake Blues (Dan Aykroyd) is released from jail and learns his brother Elwood has passed away. Even more shocking news is that his old mentor and the man he came to think of as his father Curtis has also passed away, leaving behind an illegitimate son. Determined to reform the band in their memory, Jake returns to the orphanage where he and Elwood were raised, only to be asked to care for 10 year old Buster, an orphan with an attitude similar to his own. Desperate for money to fund the band’s reformation, Jake visit’s Curtis’ son Cabel, a police sergeant. When Jake’s plea for money is unsuccessful, Buster steal’s Cabel’s wallet. The band is reformed with singer Mighty Mack (John Goodman) replacing Elwood in the lineup. With the police, the Russian Mafia and a militia group on their tails, the band travels across country to Louisiana, where they aim to win Queen Mousette’s Battle of the Bands. Also includes performances from Aretha Franklin, James Brown, Erykah Badu, B.B. King, Eric Clapton, Isaac Hayes, Bo Diddley, Dr. John, Travis Tritt, Steve Winwood and Clarence Clemmons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Landis, Dan Aykroyd, Leslie Belzberg, Robert K Weiss and Universal Pictures
